title: Adult companionship directory & booking website/app (Playboy-style aesthetic)

requirements.text: Implement Internet Identity sign-in and basic user roles (guest, signed-in user, admin) to control access to creating/editing companion profiles and reviewing booking requests.

quotes: I wanna create app and website for Playboy gigolo escorts so create like that

acceptanceCriteria: Users can sign in and sign out using Internet Identity.
Unauthenticated users can browse public pages but cannot create or submit bookings if the product requires sign-in (define which actions require sign-in and enforce consistently).
An admin role exists and can be granted by a backend-maintained allowlist of principals.
Admin-only UI actions are hidden/disabled for non-admin users and are enforced on the backend as well.

requirements.text: Create public-facing pages to browse and view individual companion profiles in a luxury magazine-inspired style (strictly non-explicit, adult-oriented branding only).

quotes: I wanna create app and website for Playboy gigolo escorts so create like that

acceptanceCriteria: A home/landing page exists with a clear brand presentation and a call-to-action to browse companions.
A browse/search page lists companions with photo, display name, location, and headline tagline.
A profile detail page shows gallery image(s), bio, services offered (worded as legal companionship categories), and availability overview.
All user-facing text is in English.
No explicit sexual content or pornography is displayed; copy is framed as legal adult companionship.

requirements.text: Add companion profile management (create, edit, publish/unpublish) for authenticated admins, including moderation controls to remove or hide profiles.
acceptanceCriteria: Admin can create a companion profile with fields: display name, headline, bio, location, age (18+), photos (URLs or uploaded static assets), tags/categories, and status (published/unpublished).
Published profiles appear on public browse pages; unpublished profiles do not.
Admin can edit and delete profiles.
Backend validates required fields and enforces 18+ requirement on stored profiles.

requirements.text: Implement a booking request flow where users can submit a request to a selected companion; admins can review, accept/reject, and track status (no real-time chat).
acceptanceCriteria: From a companion profile page, a user can open a booking request form capturing: preferred date/time, duration, location/city, and a free-text note.
Submitting creates a booking request with a status lifecycle (e.g., pending/accepted/rejected/cancelled).
Admin can view a list of booking requests, filter by status, and open a detail view.
Admin can accept or reject a request; status updates are persisted and reflected in the UI.
No WebSockets or real-time messaging is included; communication is handled via status updates and optional contact instructions text.

requirements.text: Add legal/compliance UX: age gate, Terms/Disclaimer page, and clear “18+ only” indicators throughout the app.
acceptanceCriteria: First-time visitors are shown an age gate (confirm 18+) before viewing profiles; the choice is remembered locally.
A dedicated Terms/Disclaimer page exists with non-explicit language (adult companionship, legality varies, no solicitation of illegal services).
Primary navigation/footer includes links to Terms/Disclaimer and Privacy basics.
Profile pages display an “18+ only” notice.

requirements.text: Define and apply a coherent visual theme consistent across all pages: a black/cream/gold luxury editorial aesthetic with strong typography, high-contrast layout, and “magazine spread” components.
acceptanceCriteria: A consistent color palette and typography scale is used across the app.
Buttons, cards, forms, and navigation follow the same styling rules across pages.
The UI avoids default template look and feels intentionally branded without using blue/purple as primary colors.

requirements.text: Persist all core data in the Motoko backend (profiles, booking requests, admin allowlist) with stable query/update APIs suitable for React Query usage.
acceptanceCriteria: Backend exposes query methods for listing published profiles and fetching a profile by id.
Backend exposes admin-only update methods for creating/updating/publishing/deleting profiles.
Backend exposes update methods for creating booking requests and admin-only methods for updating booking status.
All authorization checks are enforced in backend methods (principal-based).

requirements.text: Generate and include required static brand assets (logo + hero background) and render them in the UI from frontend/public/assets/generated (no backend image serving).
acceptanceCriteria: Generated images are added under frontend/public/assets/generated with the specified filenames.
Landing page uses the hero background image in a performant way (responsive, cropped appropriately).
Brand logo is shown in header/navigation and optionally in the footer.

constraints: Use only the provided stack: Motoko single-actor backend and React + TypeScript + Tailwind + Shadcn + React Query frontend.

Do not edit files in frontend immutable paths: frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, frontend/src/components/ui (compose instead).
No WebSockets/real-time chat; implement non-real-time flows only.
No third-party authentication providers; only Internet Identity.
All user-facing text must be in English.
Keep content non-explicit and include 18+ gating and disclaimers; do not add pornographic or explicit sexual content.
nonGoals: Payment processing (e.g., Stripe) unless explicitly requested later.

required: Minimal luxury wordmark logo, black/cream/gold, serif typography (logo-wordmark.dim_512x192.png)
High-contrast editorial hero background texture/pattern, dark with subtle gold accents (hero-background.dim_1920x1080.png)
